alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued March 18 at 3:28PM EDT until March 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches; greatest in the far-southern portion of the county. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southern Erie County. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times with slippery road conditions and poor visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates are expected to reach 1 to 2 inches per hour after sunset through early Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
